alert.note: Alert for Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Onondaga County through 700 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Baldwinsville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Van Buren, Baldwinsville, Solvay, Liverpool, Amboy, Camillus, New York State Fairgrounds, Galeville, Bayberry and Fairmount. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 38 and 39. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
